Home Experience

Skills

Mobile

I am proficient in both iOS and Android development and enjoy creating mobile applications for personal fun projects, hackathons, or school projects.

I first learned iOS in early 2016 through CodePath University where I served as a student leader for UF and since then have taught myself Android and have built many apps for hackathons and personal projects.

Web

I have worked with web technologies like JQuery, Vue.js, TypeScript, Rails, SQL, MongoDB,and SemanticUI.

I first learned web dev through Rob Percival's Udemy course where I painstakingly learned to use HTML and CSS to build an (unresponsive) version of CNN.

This website is built with Jekyll, Semantic UI, and is hosted on GitHub Pages.

Technology

I am a fan of learning new technologies and languages in order to bring an abstract idea into a concrete reality

My favorite language to develop in is Java, hence why I enjoy Android development so much. I have built many applications with Java as the main driver.

I am currently diving deeper into core Android development with Java.
